bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, Emilie Lawrence Reed, and Blossom Reed, January 6, 1899

div1.p: Reed writes about his life in the military. He did not receive his mother's Christmas letter. He wants to save some money and send them some gifts from Havana.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, Emilie Lawrence Reed, and Blossom Reed, January 6, 1899
div1.p:
Now that I have a few moments
to myself I will drop you a line to let you
know that I am still on top and as happy
us a clam- We are camped just a few miles
out of Havana, still we are only a stones throw
from the fasionable past- At present we
have a very pleasant location- Since we have
been here I have been a [?] of orderly for
the C. O, have an ambulance to drive in
and am on the go all the time, I have
seen quite a little of Havana,

I tell you our trip on the “Chester” was simply
an outrage & I hope when I return I will
get the other end-

Tell Mother I never got the letter she was
going to write me Xmas-

How is everything & everybody?
Today I went down to the ocean & had a
fine bath, the first I had had since
Dec 28th,

As soon as I get a little money I will
get a few things and send them to you-
Really Havana is a beautiful, place
I mean some of the store, especially the
jewelry - cutlery stores.

Everything is very clear now, but I suppose they
will come down in time-

Bob is stationed across the harbor at Morro - with two
other batteries, one is downtown, & [?] are here
they say the other batteries will come down soon-
Well as I must go to work I will close &
write more when I get a chance
with dearest love to every one & write me
soon I am
div1.closer:
Your aff Lawrence Sergt. W. L. Reed
Battery “C” 2nd U. S. Artillery
Havana
Cuba.
Please send me some stamps as I havent
one cent, & this is my last stamp-
